perturbation.original_text:
1.       DEFINITIONS

         1.1      Throughout this Agreement, and unless the context otherwise                   requires, the terms shown on Exhibit A (whether or not                   capitalized) shall have the meanings there specified. If other                   terms are defined in the text of this Agreement, then                   throughout this Agreement, those terms shall have the meanings                   respectively ascribed to them.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.       DEFINITIONS

         1.1      Throughout this Agreement, and unless the context otherwise                   requires, the terms shown on Exhibit A (whether or not                   capitalized) shall have the meanings there specified. If other                   terms are clarified within the text of this Agreement, then                   the common definition will be used, superseding other definitions.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by stating that terms defined in Exhibit A have specified meanings but then implying that in-text clarifications can override those definitions, creating a contradiction. This may result in one part of the agreement using a definition different to another, creating confusion.

perturbation.original_text:
3.2      Marketing and Sales: Regardless of ownership and in order to                   coordinate marketing and prevent overlap and confusion by                   customers and potential customers, all sales and marketing                   shall be conducted as follows:

                  3.2.1    Axiometric shall have the exclusive right to market                            and sell AMR Product Suites to entities whose                            corporate headquarters are physically located in the                            United States and U.S. territories with the exception                            of Datamatic as defined in 3.3.1 and 3.3.2 below

                  3.2.2    LKPL shall have the exclusive right to market and                            sell AMR Product Suites to Datamatic LTD, a Plano TX                            corporation (hereafter Datamatic).

                  3.2.3    LKPL shall have the exclusive right to market and                            sell AMR Product Suites to entities whose corporate                            headquarters are physically located outside the                            United States and its territories.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.2      Marketing and Sales: Regardless of ownership and in order to                   coordinate marketing and prevent overlap and confusion by                   customers and potential customers, all sales and marketing                   shall be conducted as follows:

                  3.2.1    Axiometric shall have the exclusive right to market and provide AMR Product Suites to parties whose corporate headquarters are physically located in the United States and U.S. territories with the exception of Datamatic as defined in 3.3.1 and 3.3.2 below

                  3.2.2    LKPL shall have the exclusive right to market and deliver AMR Product Suites to Datamatic LTD, a Plano TX corporation (hereafter Datamatic).

                  3.2.3    LKPL shall have the exclusive right to market and furnish AMR Product Suites to entities whose corporate headquarters are physically located outside the United States and its territories.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'sell', 'provide', 'deliver', and 'furnish' are used interchangeably to describe how the AMR product suites are distributed. This creates confusion as to the exact nature of the marketing relationship, creating an enforcement uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 3.4      Manufacturing: During the term of this Agreement, Axiometric                   shall issue a Request for Manufacture (RFM) for any AMR                   hardware to be sold by Axiometric under the terms of this                   Agreement. The RFM shall specify delivered product cost,                   credit requirements, delivery schedules, warranty service,                   quality using industry standard terms, and other industry                   standard manufacturing requirements. As the preferred                   manufacturer, LKPL shall have first right of refusal on all                   such RFMs. If LKPL does not respond to an RFM within thirty                   (30) days, or cannot provide competitive terms (such as cost,                   credit, quality, schedule), Axiometric will be free to award                   the manufacturing contract to an alternate manufacturer.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.4      Production: During the term of this Agreement, Axiometric shall issue a Request for Manufacture (RFM) for any AMR hardware to be sold by Axiometric under the terms of this Agreement. The RFM shall specify delivered product cost, credit requirements, delivery schedules, warranty service, quality using industry standard terms, and other industry standard manufacturing requirements. As the approved producer, LKPL shall have first right of refusal on all such RFMs. If LKPL does not respond to an RFM within thirty (30) days, or cannot provide competitive terms (such as cost, credit, quality, schedule), Axiometric will be free to award the production contract to an alternate manufacturer.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 3.4, 'Manufacturing' is replaced with 'Production,' and 'manufacturer' is changed to 'producer,' while 'manufacturing contract' is changed to 'production contract.' This introduces inconsistency in terminology, potentially leading to confusion about whether 'manufacturing' and 'production' have distinct meanings within the contract and weakens enforcement.
